member.name: T:MassTransit.MessageContext
member.summary: The message context includes the headers that are transferred with the message

member.name: P:MassTransit.MessageContext.MessageId
member.summary: The messageId assigned to the message when it was initially Sent. This is different than the transport MessageId, which is only for the Transport.

member.name: P:MassTransit.MessageContext.RequestId
member.summary: If the message is a request, or related to a request, such as a response or a fault, this contains the requestId.

member.name: P:MassTransit.MessageContext.CorrelationId
member.summary: If the message implements the CorrelatedBy(Guid) interface, this field should be populated by default to match that value. It can, of course, be overwritten with something else.

member.name: P:MassTransit.MessageContext.ConversationId
member.summary: The conversationId of the message, which is copied and carried throughout the message flow by the infrastructure.

member.name: P:MassTransit.MessageContext.InitiatorId
member.summary: If this message was produced within the context of a previous message, the CorrelationId of the message is contained in this property. If the message was produced from a saga instance, the CorrelationId of the saga is used.

member.name: P:MassTransit.MessageContext.ExpirationTime
member.summary: The expiration time of the message if it is not intended to last forever.

member.name: P:MassTransit.MessageContext.SourceAddress
member.summary: The address of the message producer that sent the message

member.name: P:MassTransit.MessageContext.DestinationAddress
member.summary: The destination address of the message

member.name: P:MassTransit.MessageContext.ResponseAddress
member.summary: The response address to which responses to the request should be sent

member.name: P:MassTransit.MessageContext.FaultAddress
member.summary: The fault addres to which fault events should be sent if the message consumer faults

member.name: P:MassTransit.MessageContext.Headers
member.summary: Additional application-specific headers that are added to the message by the application or by features within MassTransit, such as when a message is moved to an error queue.

member.name: P:MassTransit.MessageContext.Host
member.summary: The host information of the message producer. This may not be present if the message was sent from an earlier version of MassTransit.

member.name: T:MassTransit.Topology.Topologies.GlobalTopology
member.summary:
This represents the global topology configuration, which is delegated to by all topology instances, unless for some radical reason a bus is configured without any topology delegation.
YES, I hate globals, but they are serving a purpose in that these are really just defining the default behavior of message types, rather than actually behaving like the nasty evil global variables.
